result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mauricio A Castaneda in court with attorney Steve Compton.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 4:20 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for waiver of preliminary hearing as to 22CF415 and adjourned initial appearance on 22CT370. Court goes over waiver form with the defendant and finds waiver to be knowing, voluntary, and intelligent. State does not have information filed, but charges mirror the complaint. Based upon that, Atty. Compton enters not guilty pleas on both files and asks for status. Court sets out 90 days. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mauricio A Castaneda in court. Attorney Compton for defendant. Attorney Compton just retained last night. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22GF791 & 22CT370

NO ALCOHOL IN THE HOME. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.M.B. dob 1-27-1977 or RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Mauricio Castaneda in court, in custody by video. Attorney Vivien TenHaken for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared for bond purposes only. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Total cash bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
